snippet: The circulation of The Times increases steadily and rapidly. We have taken no special pains to make the paper known; and have employed canvassers scarcely at all. Those who have subscribed for it have done so voluntarily and because they wanted it...
lead_paragraph: The circulation of The Times increases steadily and rapidly. We have taken no special pains to make the paper known; and have employed canvassers scarcely at all. Those who have subscribed for it have done so voluntarily and because they wanted it. The immense amount of reading matter which it contains, and the cheap price at which it is issued, commend it to general favor.
